text: is a prefecture in the Kantō region on the island of Honshu, Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). Tochigi prefecture" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 967; "Kantō" at p. 479. The capital is the city of Utsunomiya.Nussbaum, at p. 1019. == History == Tochigi was made from the lands of Shimotsuke Province.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. There is a World Heritage Site in Nikkō. It is called Nikko Toshogu. ==Geography== Tochigi shares borders with Ibaraki Prefecture, Gunma Prefecture, Saitama Prefecture, and Fukushima Prefecture. ===National Parks=== National Parks are in about 21% of the total land area of the prefecture.Japan Ministry of the Environment, "General overview of area figures for Natural Parks by prefecture". Retrieved 2012-3-14. ==Shrines and Temples== Futarasan jinja and Futarayama jinja are the chief Shinto shrines (ichinomiya) in the prefecture. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 2 . Retrieved 2012-3-14. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan * Tochigi S.C. == References == == Other websites == * Tochigi Prefecture website ;
title: Tochigi Prefecture
